milk.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a white liquid produced by cows or goats that is drunk by people
milk.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Would you like some milk in your tea?
milk.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a white liquid produced by female animals and women for feeding their babies
milk.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: mothers who believe that breast milk is best for their babies
The tiny fox cubs drink nothing but their mother’s milk.
milk.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a liquid or juice produced by particular plants, especially the coconut
milk.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a thin white liquid used to clean or protect skin
milk.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: drink milk
Drinking milk keeps your bones strong.
have/take milk
Do you take milk in your coffee?
pour milk
She poured some milk into a saucepan.
ADJECTIVES/NOUN + milk
sour
Milk turns sour very quickly in hot weather.
She made me drink a glass of fresh milk.
I can only drink milk if it’s really cold.
hot/warm
Can I have a cup of warm milk please?
pasteurized
a type of cheese made from pasteurized milk
homogenized
Most milk sold in stores is homogenized milk.
whole milk
The ice cream is made from whole milk.
semi-skimmed milk
Adults should drink semi-skimmed milk rather than whole milk.
skimmed milk
a bowl of cereal with skim milk
long-life milk
I’ve got a carton of long-life milk in the cupboard.
powdered milk
Powdered milk is useful for camping trips.
baby/formula milk
Many babies are fed formula milk.
milk + NOUN
milk bottle
Put the empty milk bottles into the crates.
milk carton
containers such as milk cartons and soap powder boxes
milk jug
She put the butter, jam and milk jug on the table.
milk powder
hot water mixed with milk powder
a glass of milk
Would you like a glass of milk?
a bottle of milk
I accidentally knocked over a bottle of milk.
a pint of milk
I need to buy a pint of milk.
milk.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to get as much money or as many advantages as you can from a situation, in a very determined and sometimes dishonest way
milk.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He seems to be milking the incident for all it’s worth (=getting as much from it as possible).
Their landlord regularly milks them for extra money by claiming for damage to his property.
milk.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to take milk from a cow or goat
milk.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: I helped to milk the cows.
milk.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to get as much as you can from someone or from a situation, in a very determined and sometimes dishonest way
milk.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The cable companies will be able to milk subscribers for even more money.
